result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric W Larson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/cost to be paid to Probation while on Probation. Failure to pay may result in a civil judgment.

$250.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to Probation while on Probation. Failure to pay may result in a civil judgment.
$100.00 Domestic Abuse surcharge to be paid to Probation while on Probation. Failure to pay may result in a civil judgment.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.

Not to possess or use drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Subject to testing to determine compliance upon reasonable suspicion.  
May not vote or hold public office until civil rights are restored.  Other civil rights may be lost until restored.
If not a U.S. Citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.

Must provide a DNA sample.
Must follow through with Cognitive Thinking/Domestic Violence/Battery assessment and comply with recommendations.
Must complete an AODA assessment and comply with recommendations.

timeConds.notes:

Subject to Work Release.  NOT subject to Good Time.

supervisions.notes: Must report to Probation by close of business on 3/4/16.

Not to possess or consume alcohol.  Subject to testing to determine compliance upon reasonable suspicion.  Defendant shall neither directly or indirectly threaten, harass, intimidate or otherwise interfere with victims or witnesses in this action.  Not to commit any new crimes.  Must appear at all future court appearances.  Defendant shall give written notice to the Clerk of this Court within 48 hours of any changes of address or telephone number.  Not to have contact with: Amber Studie.
